marketNews.title: Fed Chair Jerome Powell says US economy stronger than expected
marketNews.content: Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell said on Wednesday (4/12) that the US economy is currently stronger than the Fed's expectations when it began cutting interest rates in September 2024. Powell also noted that the current strength of the US economy makes the Fed a little more cautious in finding a neutral interest rate, signalling that the Fed is likely to slow down the pace of future rate cuts.

marketNews.title: President Prabowo Subianto says IHSG could fall over free meals program
marketNews.content: President Prabowo Subianto said on Wednesday (4/12) that he received a threat that the Jakarta Composite Index (IHSG) would drop if he continues the free nutritious meals program, although he did not specify who made the threat. Prabowo added that he does not worry about the threat because he does not own any shares.

marketNews.title: IDX Director Irvan Susandy announces non-cancellation period for pre-open and pre-close trading
marketNews.content: Indonesia Stock Exchange (IDX) Director Irvan Susandy said that the exchange will implement a non-cancellation period during the pre-opening and pre-closing trading sessions. The policy will take effect in 2025, although the exact date was not disclosed. During the non-cancellation period, investors will not be able to cancel or modify existing open orders, but they may place new entry orders. The measure aims to minimise price manipulation and spoofing in the pre-opening and pre-closing sessions.

marketNews.title: Bitcoin price exceeds 100,000 USD for first time
marketNews.content: Bitcoin price surpassed 100,000 US dollars for the first time on Thursday (5/12), marking an all-time high. The price surge occurred over the past several weeks, driven by market expectations that the elected US president Donald Trump will implement looser regulations and policies supportive of crypto assets.

marketNews.title: Finance Minister Sri Mulyani releases Regulation No. 88/2024 allowing budget surplus loans
marketNews.content: Finance Minister Sri Mulyani released Minister of Finance Regulation No. 88/2024, which permits the use of budget surplus funds from the state budget as a source of loans for state-owned enterprises (BUMN), regional-owned enterprises (BUMD), local governments, and other legal entities assigned by the government. The loans can have a maximum duration of 90 calendar days and are intended to support borrower liquidity. The loans will be provided in Indonesian rupiah and constitute an uncommitted credit line. Bright Institute economist Awalil Rizky commented that the new facility could be abused by bureaucratic actors, urging the government to establish internal control reporting.

marketNews.title: Freeport Indonesia aims to restart JIIPE copper smelter in 3Q25
marketNews.content: Freeport Indonesia spokesperson Katri Krisnati said on Wednesday (4/12) that the company targets the restart of its copper smelter in JIIPE, East Java, in the third quarter of 2025, after it was halted due to a fire in October 2024. In a separate statement, MIND ID CEO Hendi Prio Santoso expressed hope that the smelter would operate normally within six months. The operational issue prompted Freeport to request the government to extend the export permit for its copper concentrate, which is set to expire at the end of this year.

tickerNews.title: AADI: Listing on IDX and PUPS exercise starting 6 Dec
tickerNews.content: Adaro Andalan Indonesia (AADI) officially listed on the IDX today, Thursday (5/12). Amid lively short-term trading discussions around the AADI IPO, we assess that investors can also consider fundamental factors for a long-term investment, especially the dividend yield. Valuation Potential Re-rating to 5-7x P/E: We forecast AADI's net profit for FY25F to decline to 934 million USD (down 27.5% YoY) due to the loss of a one-off gain from a subsidiary sale, with core profit only down 3.2% YoY. However, given the low IPO valuation of 2.9x P/E FY25F, we see high upside potential with a re-rating to 5x P/E FY25F (9,650 IDR per share, +74% from the IPO price). We consider a 5x P/E valuation as fair and conservative because it is lower than the five-year historical average P/E of its parent, Alamri Resources Indonesia (ADRO), which stands at 6.9x P/E. This valuation also lies between Bukit Asam (PTBA) at 7.3x P/E FY25F and Indo Tambangraya Megah (ITMG) at 4.8x P/E FY25F. If AADI can re-rate to the five-year ADRO average of 6.9x and approach PTBA's ~7x P/E, the implied price would be 13,525 IDR per share (+144% from the IPO price). Dividend Yield up to ~17% assuming 50% DPR: In addition to the coal price outlook we expect to remain stable, we see AADI's dividend potential for FY2025 reaching about 966 IDR per share, implying a dividend yield of roughly 17% based on the IPO share price of 5,550 IDR. This assumes a dividend payout ratio (DPR) of 50%, which is the three-year average DPR of ADRO. The yield is higher than other large coal producers such as ITMG and PTBA. Although management stated in the prospectus a plan to distribute dividends with DPR up to 45%, we consider a 50% DPR assumption not aggressive given the company has no large capex plans in the near term. With a 50% DPR and the annual net profit level, we also judge that AADI has sufficient funds to develop its two coal mines, Pari Coal and Ratah Coal, if needed. Main Assumptions in Our Analysis: - Average Newcastle coal price of 135 USD per ton in 2024 and 130 USD per ton in 2025, reflecting a normalization from the current level of 134.8 USD per ton. - Sales volume of 63 million tons in 2024 (down 0.6% YoY) and 64 million tons in 2025 (up 1.6% YoY). - Cash costs of 56.2 USD per ton in 2024 (down 12% YoY) and 57.8 USD per ton in 2025 (up 2.9% YoY). - Non-operating income drops sharply in 2025 (down 89.4% YoY) due to the loss of the one-off gain from asset disposals. Key Takeaway: Although many investors may buy AADI for short-term trading opportunities, we view AADI as a solid fundamental investment given the relatively stable coal outlook and significant, recurring dividend yield. Starting Friday (6/12) through Tuesday (10/12) at 10:00 WIB, investors holding rights to exercise AADI PUPS (ADRO-H) can do so on the Stockbit app. The dividend that can be used for the ADRO-H exercise will be credited on Friday (6/12). AADI rose 19.8% to 6,650 IDR per share today (5/12); the exercise price is 5,971 IDR per share (including a 0.18% transaction fee as stipulated in the PUPS prospectus). How to exercise ADRO-H on Stockbit: 1. Swipe right on ADRO-H in the Portfolio page, then click Exercise. 2. Enter the amount of ADRO-H you wish to exercise, then click Exercise.

tickerNews.title: BUMI targets coal production of 80 million tons in 2025
tickerNews.content: BUMI Resources reported that it targets coal production volume of around 80 million tons in 2025, which is 2.6-5.3% higher than the 2024 production projection of 76-78 million tons. BUMI itself recorded a coal production volume of 57.3 million tons (up 2% YoY) during the first nine months of 2024, with coal sales of 55.8 million tons (up 2.8% YoY). In a separate occasion, BUMI also plans to conduct a private placement of approximately 16.1 million shares on 11 December 2024 to execute conversion of mandatory convertible bonds, although the issue price has not been announced.

tickerNews.title: PANI: Pantai Indah Kapuk Dua property project continues as planned
tickerNews.content: Pantai Indah Kapuk Dua (PANI) Company Secretary Christy Grassela said that the development of the property project in PIK 2 continues as scheduled and is not affected by the controversy over the strategic national project (PSN) status of Tropical Coastland, which is part of the PIK 2 development plan. Previously, the Minister of Agrarian Affairs and Spatial Planning/National Land Agency, Nusron Wahid, said President Prabowo Subianto would review the PSN status. This week, the Coordinating Ministry for Economic Affairs Secretary Susiwijono Moegiarso said his office will facilitate discussions between the government and PANI regarding the issue.

tickerNews.title: MEDC plans 2.5 trillion IDR bond issuance
tickerNews.content: Medco Energi Internasional (MEDC) plans to issue bonds worth 2.5 trillion rupiah, with the proceeds intended for refinancing existing bonds and repaying part of a loan to a subsidiary. The bond issue consists of Series A worth approximately 1.7 trillion rupiah (interest rate 7.75% and tenor 5 years) and Series B worth 825 billion rupiah (interest rate 8.25% and tenor 7 years). The public offering is scheduled to run from 27 December 2024 to 2 January 2025. The bond has received an idAA- rating from Pefindo.

tickerNews.title: MTEL acquires additional fiber optic network
tickerNews.content: Dayamitra Telekomunikasi (MTEL) reports that it will receive an additional fiber optic network of 8,101 km and a billable length of 12,524 km from the acquisition of PT Ultra Mandiri Telekomunikasi. Consequently, MTEL's total fiber optic network increases from 39,714 km to more than 47,800 km. Previously, MTEL acquired 99.3% of PT Ultra Mandiri Telekomunikasi for approximately 645.5 billion rupiah, a divestment from PT PP (PTPP). MTEL President Director Theodorus Ardi Hartoko said the company will continue selective expansion, not only in tower business but also in fiber optics and related services.

tickerNews.title: SRAJ private placement and debt purchase
tickerNews.content: Sejahteraraya Anugrahjaya (SRAJ) announced that BCCS Maverick (A) I LP will take a stake worth 32 million USD in the new share issuance of SRAJ. The purchase price has not been disclosed, and the transaction is part of a private placement of up to 1.2 billion shares (10%) approved in the Independent General Meeting of Shareholders in August 2024. Additionally, SRAJ announced that BCSS Maverick Holdings I LP, BCSS Maverick Holdings II LP, and BCCS Maverick (A) I LP will purchase corporate bonds with a principal amount of 125 million USD. These entities are part of Bain Capital Credit LP, a US private investment firm.

tickerNews.title: DUTI interim dividend 2024
tickerNews.content: Duta Pertiwi (DUTI) will distribute an interim dividend for fiscal year 2024 amounting to 703 billion rupiah or 380 rupiah per share. The cum-date is on the regular market and the trade will occur on 12 December 2024, with payment on 23 December 2024. Based on DUTI's share price on Thursday (5/12) at 4,400 rupiah per share, the implied dividend yield is 8.6%.

tickerNews.title: HERO changes name to DFI Retail Nusantara
tickerNews.content: Shareholders of Hero Supermarket approved on Wednesday (4/12) the change of the company's name to DFI Retail Nusantara. Hero President Director Hadrianus Wahyu Trikusumo said the name change is due to Hero's divestment of its Hero Supermarket business to an affiliated entity, PT Hero Ritel Nusantara, at the end of June 2024. Going forward, Hero will focus on the beauty and health retail segment through Guardian and the household segment through IKEA. No details on capex allocation or store expansion targets for 2025 were provided. As of November 2024, Hero operates 340 Guardian stores.

tickerNews.title: BJBR to issue 1 trillion IDR bond
tickerNews.content: Bank Pembangunan Daerah Jawa Barat dan Banten (BJBR) plans to issue a 1 trillion rupiah bond, with the proceeds intended for financing. The bond consists of Series A of 200 billion rupiah (interest rate 7% and tenor 3 years) and Series B of 800 billion rupiah (interest rate 7.3% and tenor 5 years). The public offering is scheduled for 3-5 December 2024. The bond has received an idAA rating from Pefindo.

tickerNews.title: BNBR private placement of 13.4 billion shares
tickerNews.content: Bakrie & Brothers (BNBR) plans to conduct a private placement of approximately 13.4 billion shares at a price of 64 rupiah per share on 10 December 2024 to execute conversion of mandatory convertible bonds. All new shares will be taken by Eurofa Capital Investment Inc. and Silvery Moon Investment Ltd., which are not affiliated with the company.
